description: Numbers n such that n | Sigma(n) - d(n) - Phi(n) and n is not a prime or twice a prime, where d(n) is the number of divisors of n.
mathematica: Do[ If[ And[ !PrimeQ[ n ], !PrimeQ[ n/2 ] ], If[ Mod[ DivisorSigma[ 1, n ]-DivisorSigma[ 0, n ]- EulerPhi[ n ], n ]==0, Print[ n ] ] ], {n, 1, 10^8} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 19 2000
